title.narrative: OUTPUT 4.2: GIRLS EDUCATION

description.narrative: By 2020, actors of the education system have increased capacity to create a learning environment conducive to girls' enrolment, reintegration and completion of basic education cycle, which contributes to Early Learning, Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, children aged 3 to 16, especially girls from the most disadvantaged regions, have increased and equitable access to quality early childhood development and gender responsive basic education services.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, actors of the education system have increased capacity to create a learning environment conducive to girls? enrolment,reintegration and completion of basic education cycle

description.narrative: In 2020, significant progress was made on girls’ education. Following the national strategy for girls’ reintegration, the Ministry of Education adopted a text to enforce the decision and facilitate its implementation. Through a community-based education approach, the Country Office supported the set-up of 50 additional Mothers and Girls’ Clubs (CMEF) to promote girls’ education, particularly in preschool. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:19/01/2021
